reviews.review_msg: He is a really nice person and extremely approachable. Sometimes the material was a bit boring but he did try to make it interesting. The exams are very fair and straight from the notes. Read the papers he tells you to and you'll ace the exam. If you're going to take this class, take it with him.
He is SUCH a nice person, a sweetheart! As a prof, he explains things well but it's so hard to listen because the material is very dry...

Class was simple enough, however the material is extremely boring. His exams are straight forward and out of the notes. Although this is an easy class, if you have no interest in proteins DO NOT TAKE IT. You will find studying to be a very brutal chore.
His lectures are always clear and very interesting. He includes the history of the field as well as the most up to date findings. One of the best profs I have ever had.

I agree with the comment below. He is extremely disorganized, unprepared and hard to follow this semester. The notes are never updated and usually people have no idea what is going on in class. Some class material is extremely repetitive and he skips over a lot of the other stuff.

I don't know what happened to this man, but he is now a very different person.  Even my TA who had him before said the same thing.  His lectures are slow, the notes are never updated or sent out on time, and he alleges that he does not want you to memorize, but yet his second midterm had a list of vocabulary to fill out.  This was brutal.
BEST MBB PROFESSOR!!!  HE'S ALWAYS HELPFUL AND UNDERSTAND!!
the coolest MBB prof ever!!!  He's the man!
Great new prof.  He makes the uninteresting, interesting.

I found the exams to be fair, though the second midterm was tricky. This course involves applying knowledge rather than regurgitating facts. Dr. Young is very knowledgeable and provides thorough answers to all questions presented and asked in lecture. This is not an easy course, but definitely interesting and worth taking.
Im totally speechless about this course. I swear I did not learn anything about it. Until now I still dont see how are the materials relate to one another.
Pretty hard course..but did his final help a bit or I am totally off?

Good at communicating ideas, but has a tiny voice (either that or his microphone doesn't work too well) and can make you feel a little dumb at times... Too much physics/math for a biochem course! Notes could be more organized. Exams are difficult and marking is quite subjective. The protein profile was pretty interesting, though.

course started off great and cohesive. but unfortunately ended like a train wreck. course name is protein structure and function but was more focused technical aspects of EM, crystallography, NMR. this may be great for graduates already doing protein research but unfair for undergraduates. course is definately not easy.

I advise any prospective students,do not take this teacher if you dont have to!!! Very disorganized, his tests are left to ur own interpretation yet he marks subjectively. Hated the course because of the teacher!! Don't take him!!! u were warned!!!
